pageContext.claim: “Bernie Sanders' healthcare plan would cost over $32 trillion a year. That's more money than we make in five years, that's more money than we'll ever make.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is confused here, citing a ten-year estimate as an annual number. It is commonly estimated that the Sanders Medicare-for-All plan would require an additional $32 trillion in federal spending over ten years. (The number is subject to dispute.) The U.S. economy, as suggested by the gross domestic product, is estimated to be about $22 trillion in 2020, or more than $100 trillion over five years.
